description: From Middle English *persishable, perysabyl, equivalent to perish +‎ -able. Compare Old French perissable (and modern French périssable).

adjectives.description: perishable (comparative more perishable, superlative most perishable)

entries.meaning: Liable to perish, especially naturally subject to quick decomposition or decay.
That which perishes or is short-lived.
(in the plural) food that does not keep for long.
